TopicTitle: Collider collision detector, better environment interaction for KSP 1.2

Articles.Content:
In normal language: a mechanical switch. A module that detects if it is being touched or hit, then switches/toggles an action group, toggles resource flow, generates resource, etc.

Reason: The amount of sensors being really capable of being interactive with the environment is ... limited. Therefore limits creativity.

Plea: The vision of building low resolution space things (i.e. command pod, tank, engine) is narrow. It's nice for a first product.

The editor is capable of creating so much more, and the future market demands it. Be ready, or be swept away by upcoming titles. The editor is the game's strongest asset, it's fast and very easy to use. The whole space thing may be the roots, but the editor is the platform to expand from into other territories. Don't expect the competition to do nothing and I repeat: space is NOT the final frontier.
I've started learning to code myself, gotta have it! :-)
In the mean time you could try SmartParts. There's a proximity sensor in there (but it probably doesn't work the way you want).
